snippet: The move makes Washington the latest in a series of states to step away from capital punishment and makes Gov. Jay Inslee the third Democratic governor in recent years to say something similar.
abstract: Jay Inslee, governor of Washington State, announces that no executions will take place in state while he remains in office, despite fact that death penalty is legal there; move makes Washington latest in series of states to step away from capital punishment and makes Inslee third Democratic governor in recent years to take similar position.
lead_paragraph: The move makes Washington the latest in a series of states to step away from capital punishment and makes Gov. Jay Inslee the third Democratic governor in recent years to say something similar.

headline.main: Executions Are Suspended by Governor in Washington
headline.print_headline: Executions Are Suspended by Governor in Washington
